results.title: Today's culture: options after high school
results.creator_credit: Henry Blinder and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: It’s no longer a matter of go to college or go to work. Options have changed, and it’s up to the individual to find the lifestyle and education that fits the person’s need. Interviews with people who have found their niches both academically and non-academically show the wide range of opportunities now open.

results.title: Tobruk to Tarakan
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australia. Repatriation Dept.
results.brief_description: Presents a chronological study of the Australian Army’s involvement in the various theatres of WWII: Greece, Crete, Syria, Tobruk, Alamein, Pacific, New Guinea, Taraken. Archival footage from Australian War Memorial.

results.title: Tobacco supply of the world
results.brief_description: General account of the production of tobacco, with special reference to Southern Rhodesia; includes a study of an actual tobacco estate; with its seasonal activities and life in the native kraal.

results.title: Tobacco growing
results.brief_description:
Cultivation of tobacco, season by season on a Southern Rhodesian estate, from the preparation of the ground to the curing and grading of the leaves.
This is a silent film.

results.title: Toads: some are, some aren't
results.brief_description: Two “talking” animals - Warty Bliggens, a true toad and Cactus Clyden, a horned toad - describes the characteristics of their bodies, their behaviour and there natural habitats. Close up photography reveals the differences between the two animals, and the viewer soon learns that the horned toad is not a toad at all, but a horned lizard with entirely different characteristics from those of the true toad

results.title: Toads
results.brief_description: The toad is seen as one of the few remaining descendants of the prehistoric amphibians. Shows the life cycle from a water-born to a land-dwelling animal, and how the toad procures food, protects itself and can live even in desert areas.

results.title: To your health
results.brief_description: Referring to the many varied opinions about alcohol, the film sets out to deal only with facts. The distribution and fate of the drug in the body is shown, and its anaesthetic properties affecting reasoning, inhibitions, memory, the special senses and muscular co-ordination described.

results.title: To touch a child
results.brief_description: Shows an example of an American school which opened its doors as a community centre for sport, entertainment, and educational activities. Explains how the community responded to the successful project and how it has extended to further schools in the city.

results.title: To the top
results.brief_description: This film documents the construction of C.N. Tower in Toronto Canada, which is the world’s tallest freestanding structure, built as a link for nation wide communications. The first 1500ft of the tower is concrete, followed by an observation deck and atop of this a 300ft antenna. The film explains in detail the construction techniques used to build the tower from the ground upwards assisted by the use of cranes and a helicopter. Excellent use of time-lapse photography shows the progression of construction, where 22ft of the tower is added on to every 24 hours. The challenge made by the builders to make this tower is even made harder by the freezing temperatures and snow. A 70’s score accompanies the superb photographic views with the inclusion of some nice chunky base riffs and a stummy divergence, which is reminiscent of the theme from The Love Boat.

results.title: To the rescue
results.brief_description: Air Ambulance: Saskatchewan’s air ambulance service brings quick relief to the sick or injured. Rocky Mountain Rescue: Rescue techniques used by park wardens and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police to aid stranded or injured mountain climbers are demonstrated. Avalanche Experts: In the Canadian Rockies the experts often anticipate and prevent avalanches.
